result.title: Web site development and maintenance
result.description: A project web site will be designed by a web development agency under the coordination of AREA. The website will include all relevant public information about the project. The first release of the website will be at month 6 but it will be contantly updated through the whole life of the project. It will address both companies willing to participate to the PCP call and other procurers interested in capitalizing over project experience. The web site will be available in English and in all partners national languages.

result.title: REELER online, interactive toolbox
result.description: P2 ABACUS will design a set of management tools to ease the access and use of the REELER Roadmap by robot designers. An online toolbox (D7.3) the REELER Roadmap will be developed and tested as final output of the task. The toolbox is an engine accessible through the REELER website, aiming at making the roadmap accessible from the point of view of the designer/developer. The basic concept is to allow surfing the results of the REELER research by means of keywords and parameters suitable to identify specific navigation paths in terms of expected end users of the robotic solution, its level of maturity according to the human proximity model and other relevant factor in design and development pointed out in the REEER project. P3 ABACUS is responsible for presenting the toolbox at the end conference for all stakeholders, representatives of REP and Mini-Publics.
